Sentencas: Nd2NiO4+delta infiltrated into porous yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) is proposed in this work as a cathode for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes

Sentencas: In order to obtain nickelate single phase, calcination times and temperatures of the salt precursors are studied.
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes

Sentencas: Anode supported microtubular cells using this cathode are fabricated and characterized, showing power densities of about 0.76 W cm(-2) at 800 degrees C and a voltage as high as 0.8 V.
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes

Sentencas: No degradation is detected after 24 hours under current load, assuring reasonable stability of the cell.
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes

Sentencas: Preliminary solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) results show slightly better performances in comparison with SOFC operation.
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes

Sentencas: It is believed that infiltration of nickelate salt precursors followed by calcination proposed in this work avoids high temperature sintering of the nickelate phase with the electrolyte and.

Sentencas: For this reason, infiltrated nickelates are very attractive for their use as intermediate temperature (IT) SOFC cathodes.
Titulo: High performance of microtubular solid oxide fuel cells using Nd2NiO4+δ-based composite cathodes
